page.title: 08Stodmarsh Reserve/Maint'nce
page.content:
How the Reserve is looked after.{ { ________________________________ There is a warden who is responsible for maintainance in the {nature reserve.}The{nature reserve {warden}is at present building a nature trail through part of the reserve. His job mainly concerns looking after the wildlife and keeping the reeds watered; he does this by trapping water in ditches with{sluice gates}and in dry weather they are opened to water the reeds.
There is a good car park specially for the Reserve, at the{Stodmarsh}end. The footpath through the reserve is built upon the{Lampen Wall.}A new wall is now being built in and around the reserve to prevent the salt water of the Stour from entering the lakes.
